pageContext.claim: “I thought that the definition of Antifa [given to Congress, under oath, by FBI Director Chris Wray, a Trump appointee] was an absolutely incorrect definition, so I speak up. I like to speak up. I have fantastic people.”
pageContext.analysis: Wray accurately testified that Antifa is more "an ideology than an organization." Law enforcement officials say there is no single "Antifa" group that is able to raise money or direct members. Instead, many disparate actors call themselves "Antifa" and participate in public disruptions.
